intro: Aspalathus sanguinea subsp. sanguinea, commonly known as the red bush willow, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its reddish-brown bark and oval, glossy leaves that are opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by spherical, woody fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine and for ornamental purposes.
